column4: during booting, my systems gets stuck at "running /scripts/init-bottom" & goes into text mode, whats the problem ?
sounds like something got munged, is there anything else on the screen?any errors? can you get to a terminal?  (alt f2)
:i got  soft lock : CPU#0 stuck for 11s [init:1]
i've encountered that before and it's due to filesystem corruption, use a fsck and force the rebuild, i don't recall the exact command
i can't get into the console to do a fsck !
you need to use a live cd, either your ubuntu disk or a knoppix disk
i did a fsck earlier, reported some errors..& the console got stuck
ok..
fsck --force /dev/sd1   (or whathaveyou)
what will when i run this "fsck --force /dev/sd1" will the errors get corrected ?
it did for me, but your mileage may vary
what will happen when i run this "fsck --force /dev/sd1" will the errors get corrected ?
are you using a seagate drive over 750gb?
160gb seagate..
40gb for ubuntu, remaining for winne...
yeah, i'd run the fsck, and contact customer support if it's still bad and get a replacement if it's under warranty
what is this "soft lock : cpu#0 stuck for 11s" ?
this code detects soft lockups: incidents in where on a CPU the kernel does not reschedule for 10 seconds or more
i am getting this softlock "bug" after a unsuccessful fsck...
you ran the force?
no.
go do that and see if it still persists
k.
i will do fsck with force option, thanks for suggestion....
